Class DebugShell

java.lang.Object
microsim.ui.DebugShell
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimulationListener
public class DebugShell extends Object implements SimulationListener
Handles the shell shown in debug mode. Debug information is shown in 2 ways:
  1. Via the log(java.lang.String) method, which prints event information mid-cycle.
  2. Via the shell() method, which offers interactive debugging at the beginning of simulation cycles.

  • Field Details

    • nextShellCycle

      private int nextShellCycle
      Next cycle to show shell at. Used with
      invalid reference 
      #nextShellStep
      to jump to specific cycle.

    • shouldShowShell

      private boolean shouldShowShell
      Signals whether shell should be shown or not. Used with
      invalid reference 
      #nextShellStep
      to jump to specific cycle.

    • simulationInstance

      private Simulation simulationInstance
      Simulation instance to debug. Used to access processor and memory information from shell.

      public DebugShell()

  • Method Details

    • attachSimulation

      public void attachSimulation(Simulation simulationInstance)
      Attaches a new simulation instance to the debug shell.
      Parameters:
      simulationInstance - simulation instance to attach

    • detachSimulation

      public void detachSimulation()
      Detaches attached simulation instance. If no simulation instance is attached, nothing changes.

    • int32ToString

      public static String int32ToString(int val)
      Helper to convert an int to a hexadecimal string. Used by this class and as an utility to build DebugEvent messages.
      Parameters:
      val - int to convert
      Returns:
      hexadecimal hex string representing int

    • printEPROM

      public static void printEPROM(byte[] eprom)
      Prints EPROM data array word by word. Used as an utility by whoever gets data from Elf.
      Parameters:
      eprom - EPROM data array

    • printProcessorRegisters

      private void printProcessorRegisters()
      Fetches processor registers from processor in current simulation and prints them.

    • printProcessorMicroOps

      private void printProcessorMicroOps()
      Fetches MicroOp queue from processor in current simulation and prints it.

    • readMemoryAtAddress

      private void readMemoryAtAddress(String addr)
      Reads and prints data from memory at given address. Checks valid addresses and out of bound reads.
      Parameters:
      addr - the address to read from

    • writeMemoryAtAddress

      private void writeMemoryAtAddress(String addr, String data)
      Writes data to memory at given address. Checks valid addresses, valid data and out of bound writes.
      Parameters:
      addr - the address to read from

    • onSimulationEvent

      public void onSimulationEvent(SimulationEvent e)
      Receives a simulation event. SimulationEvent events that return a non-null debug string are logged, and CycleEvent events launch the interactive shell.
      Specified by:
      onSimulationEvent in interface SimulationListener
      Parameters:
      e - simulation event

    • log

      private void log(String message)
      Logs a debug message.
      Parameters:
      message - message to display

    • shell

      private void shell()
      Displays a debug shell for the current simulation instance. The shell offers the following commands:
      • step: steps execution by 1 cycle. Operand can be specified to specify at which step to stop.
      • quit: halts execution and quits.
      • proc: offers processor information with following options:
        • registers: prints all registers:
        • pipeline: prints pipeline information:
      • mem: offers memory information with following options:
        • read: reads memory at address.
        • write: writes memory at address.
      • render: forces screen rendering
